resources.string: It\'s fruit and vegetable scraps, non-greasy food scraps (rice, pasta, bread, cereal etc.), coffee grounds & filters, tea bags, egg and nut shells, pits, cut or dried flowers, houseplants and potting soil.
Why recycle food waste to compost?

Food comprises about 17% of NYC\'s waste stream. When this material is sent to a landfill it contributes to NYCs disposal costs and can create greenhouse gas emissions. When composted, food scraps and other organic waste become a useful product that adds nutrients and improves the quality of soil for street trees, gardens and more.
Why recycle food waste at all?

New York City has shown incredible leadership on food waste recycling to first prevent, then recover, and finally recycle any remaining food with implement government policy and laws along with dedicated and simple organic waste recycling practices.
Food scrap drop off sites returned.
